Key Match Events: Domantas Sabonis recorded 28 rebounds, the most by a Celtics opponent since Ben Wallace in March 2002.
DeMar DeRozan scored 24 points and Malik Monk added 22 points.
Jaylen Brown led all scorers with 28 points, while Kristaps Porzingis contributed 22 points and 10 rebounds.
Jayson Tatum had a double-double with 15 points, 12 rebounds, and 5 assists but committed 8 turnovers.
Sacramento Kings outscored Boston by 17 points in the fourth quarter, leading to a 114-97 loss.
Devin Carter hit back-to-back three-pointers to open the fourth quarter, giving Sacramento the lead.
Pre-Game Insights: The Celtics were expected to struggle due to their recent inconsistent performance.
Post-Match Reflections: Jaylen Brown stated that the Celtics deserved the boos and groans from the early-departing crowd.
Head coach Joe Mazzulla acknowledged that the team needs to improve defensively and in shot-making.
Kristaps Porzingis expressed confidence in the team's ability to bounce back from the loss.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was tied entering the fourth quarter.
The Celtics' bench provided a spark, scoring nine points in the first half.
